perturbation.original_text: This Promotion and Distribution Agreement including all exhibits (collectively referred to as the "Agreement"), effective as of 1 August 2011 (the  "Effective Date"), is made by and between Whitesmoke Inc., with registered offices/principle place of business at 501 Silverside Road, Suite 105,  Wilmington DE 19809, USA, ("Distributor"), and Google Inc whose principle place of business is at 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View,  CA 94043, USA ("Google").
perturbation.changed_text: This Promotion and Distribution Agreement including all exhibits (collectively referred to as the "Arrangement"), effective as of 1 August 2011 (the  "Effective Date"), is made by and between Whitesmoke Inc., with registered offices/principle place of business at 501 Silverside Road, Suite 105,  Wilmington DE 19809, USA, ("Vendor"), and Google Inc whose principle place of business is at 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View,  CA 94043, USA ("Google").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Agreement' is replaced by 'Arrangement', and 'Distributor' is replaced by 'Vendor'. This creates confusion because the document does not define 'Arrangement' or 'Vendor', and other sections will continue to use 'Agreement' and 'Distributor,' leading to uncertainty about whether these terms are interchangeable.

perturbation.original_text: Distributor shall begin such distribution within [ * ] following Google's request.
perturbation.changed_text: The Vendor shall begin such distribution within [ * ] following Google's request.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Distributor' is changed to 'Vendor' in the same sentence, within Section 2.6 (Updated Versions of Distribution Products). The change conflicts with the original designation in the preamble of the document.

perturbation.original_text: Distributor may charge interest at the rate of [ * ] above the base rate of Barclays Bank PLC from time to time, from the due date  until the date of actual payment, whether before or after judgment, on any payment pursuant to this Clause 4 (Payment Terms) which is  overdue.
perturbation.changed_text: The Seller may charge interest at the rate of [ * ] above the base rate of Barclays Bank PLC from time to time, from the due date  until the date of actual payment, whether before or after judgment, on any payment pursuant to this Clause 4 (Payment Terms) which is  overdue.
perturbation.explanation: In Section 4.5 (Interest), 'Distributor' is replaced by 'Seller.' The introduction of 'Seller' without definition contradicts the initial designation of Whitesmoke Inc. as 'Distributor' (or 'Vendor' in the earlier change) and creates ambiguity regarding which entity is entitled to charge interest on overdue payments.
